result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic J Fajfrowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
Pay supervision fees.
Defendant may continue 3rd party contact to spend time with the children.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.  If the probation agent determines that batterer's treatment is needed, the agent is to contact the court to schedule a review hearing.
No contact with firearms due to the DV conviction.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominic J Fajfrowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dominic J Fajfrowski in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 year with the following conditions:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.  If the probation agent determines that batterer's treatment is needed, the agent is to contact the court to schedule a review hearing.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms due to the DV conviction.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
-Defendant may continue 3rd party contact to spend time with the children. 
Defense request for expungement is denied by the court.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Dominic J Fajfrowski in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominic J Fajfrowski in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Court ordered all discovery turned over, and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of trial date.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  
Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned to Branch 23 for a Pretrial Conference.
